JAN 7 1901
ROLLS DIVISION.

NOTED: RETURNS, A. G. O.,
9

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS, & D. C. DIV.
REC'D DEC. 31 1900
ADJUTANT GENERALS OFFICE.

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 177 B 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 25. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, December 20, 1900.

1. Leave of absence for one (1) month, with permission
to go beyond the limits of the Department, is hereby
granted Lieutenant W. W. Whitside, 10th Cavalry.

2. The following assignment of paymasters to pay troops
on the muster of December 31, 1900, is hereby made:

Major F. S. Dodge, Paymaster, U. S. Army, Chief Pay-
master of the Department, in person, at Morro Castle, San-
tiago; by express at San Luis, Guantánamo, Manzanillo,
Bayamo, Holguin and Puerto Principe;

Major J. W. Dawes, Additional Paymaster, U. S. Volun-
teers, in person, at Columbia Barracks, Cabaña Barracks
and the posts and batteries constituting the defenses of
Havana;

Major Otto Becker, Additional Paymaster, U. S. Volun-
teers, in person, at Hamilton Barracks and Rowell Bar-
racks; by express at Ciego de Avila.

The commanding officers will send the payrolls of their
respective commands, signed by the men, and accompanied
by the deposit books, as soon as practicable after muster,
to the paymasters. When the payments have been made,
the payrolls, duly certified by the witnessing officers, with
such money as may not have been paid, will be returned to
the paymasters without delay.

The Quartermaster's Department will, under paragraph
1128, Army Regulations, furnish transportation for funds,
by express, to and from the points designated.

Upon the completion of the duties assigned them, the
paymasters will return to their proper stations.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. The Quartermaster's Depot at Cienfuegos, Cuba, hav-
ing been abolished, Captain Walter B. Barker, Assistant
Quartermaster, U. S. Volunteers, is hereby detailed as Dis-
bursing Officer of Island Funds and Paymaster of Rural
Guards, with station at Cienfuegos, Cuba, relieving 1st
Lieutenant W. A. Raibourn, 10th Infantry, of so much of
these duties as are now performed by him, receiving from
and receipting to the latter mentioned officer for Island
funds and property in his possession and pertaining to the
offices above referred to.

Lieutenant Raibourn upon being relieved as above indi-
cated will remain on duty, with station at Cienfuegos,
Cuba, as Engineer Officer of the District of Cienfuegos, and
is in addition thereto temporarily detailed as Inspector of
Rural Guards.

Captain Barker is hereby authorized to retain so much
of his present clerical force as may be necessary for the
proper transaction of the public business involved, payment
for the same to be made from Island funds.

4. In addition to the duties already assigned him, Captain
Walter B. Barker, Assistant Quartermaster, U. S. Volun-
teers, will assume general supervision of construction work
now under charge of Captain H. B. Chamberlin, Assistant
Quartermaster, U. S. Volunteers, at Colón, Cuba, relieving
the latter mentioned officer of the duties connected there-
with and receipting to him for Island funds and property
pertaining thereto.

Such number of journeys as may be necessary to carry
out these orders and to enable Captain Baker to familiarize
himself with the work are authorized.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. Captain H. B. Chamberlin, Assistant Quartermaster,
U. S. Volunteers, upon being relieved by Captain Barker,
as provided in paragraph 4 of this order, will proceed to
Havana, Cuba, for the purpose of settling his accounts, and
take station thereat.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

6. Upon the recommendation of the Acting Chief Surgeon,
privates William Olson and James Hilderbrand, Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, are hereby relieved from duty at Co-
lumbia Barracks, and will report to Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U. S. Army, Camp Lazear (experimental camp),
Quemados, for temporary duty.

7. Upon the recommendation of the Acting Chief Surgeon
of the Department, private John R. Kissinger, Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, is hereby detailed as Acting Hospital
Steward.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Adjutant General.
